Article Title: Veteran from his own party questions Tejashwi projection as ‘jannayak’
Article Text:
Patna: LoP in Bihar Assembly and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav addresses the media after releasing INDIA bloc's manifesto for Bihar Assembly elections, in Patna. (PTI Photo)(PTI10_28_2025_000392B)

‘Bihar Got Not Even 1% of Gujarat’s Share’: Tejashwi Yadav Explodes at PM Modi

PATNA: INDIA bloc CM face Tejashwi Yadav 's projection as "jannayak (people's leader)" and "nayak (hero)" has been contested not only by BJP but also by a senior within his own RJD , with its national general secretary Abdul Bari Siddiqui taking exception to such labels.Siddiqui said it would take Tejashwi time and hard work to get the title of Jannayak, which is exclusively used for former Bihar CM and Bharat Ratna Karpoori Thakur. "Tejashwi is engaged in politics based on his father and RJD chief Lalu Prasad's legacy. He is the virasat (legacy) of Lalu Prasad's politics and may get this honour after establishing himself by following the footsteps of his father and Thakur," Siddiqui added.While RJD posters with Tejashwi's photograph, captioned "Bihar ka Nayak" have come up ahead of next month's assembly elections, he as well as Congress Lok Sabha opposition leader Rahul Gandhi were first called jannayak during "Voter Adhikar Yatra" in the state over a month ago against the special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. The row seems to have intensified after Congress put up social media posts on Monday with videos and photos of Rahul, describing him as jannayak.Tejashwi's estranged elder brother Tej Pratap also disapproved of such titles. "Calling yourself jannayak doesn't make you a people's leader. Karpoori Thakur, Ram Manohar Lohia, Ambedkar and Mahatma Gandhi were the real jannayaks. Rahul and Tejashwi are under the "chatrachaya (protection and patronage) of Lalu Prasad. If that protection is removed, they will be nothing," Tej Pratap said.BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla seized on Siddiqui's statement to claim that neither the public nor his own colleagues had confidence in Tejaswhi. "Despite contesting elections for years, he has failed to earn people's trust. Even within his circle, from RJD's Abdul Bari Siddiqui to SP MLA Ravidas Mehrotra, besides his brother Tej Pratap, no one sees him as a true leader," he said.Another BJP spokesperson, Ajay Alok, took the title tiff further, saying Tejashwi "is not a nayak but nalayak".
Article Summary: Tejashwi Yadav's projection as "jannayak (people's leader)" and "nayak" has been contested not only by BJP but also by a senior within his own RJD. RJD national general secretary Abdul Bari Siddiqui took exception to such labels.

Article Title: Bihar polls: Chirag Paswan backs Nitish Kumar as NDA's CM face; clarifies Amit Shah's remark
Article Text:
In Khagariya, Amit Shah Frames Bihar Poll As Choice Between NDA's Five Pandavas And RJD's Jungle Raj

NEW DELHI: Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan on Tuesday endorsed Nitish Kumar as the NDA's chief ministerial face for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections and offered clarification on Union minister Amit Shah's recent "MLAs will decide" remark."How many times does it need to be said that chief minister Nitish Kumar is the NDA's face," Paswan told reporters in Delhi, adding that "the coalition is contesting the polls under Nitish’s leadership.""Chief minister Nitish Kumar is leading the elections, and as the Home Minister has already said, MLAs will come and MLAs will elect — that’s the normal democratic process," the Hajipur MP said."When people cite Rajasthan’s or Madhya Pradesh's example, they forget that in there, one party was contesting and had already declared its CM face," he added.Paswan’s remarks came days after Amit Shah clarified that while the NDA is contesting under Nitish Kumar’s leadership, the decision on who will be chief minister will be taken after the elections by the elected legislators."Who am I to say so? Yes, we are contesting the polls under Nitish Kumar’s leadership. After the elections, NDA legislators will decide who will be CM," Shah had said, sparking speculation that the BJP might be keeping its options open.The LJP (Ram Vilas) chief also took aim at the Opposition’s INDIA bloc for declaring RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav as its chief ministerial candidate."By mistake, and under pressure from his party, he has been named CM candidate — and he’s behaving as if he’s already the CM," the Union minister said."Rahul Gandhi avoided doing this because he knows that as soon as Tejashwi is projected, people will start recalling the jungle raj and recoil in fear," he added.He further accused the RJD of coercing its allies, claiming that promises like the deputy CM post to Vikassheel Insaan Party leader Mukesh Sahni were politically motivated. "And what do they hope to gain by promising Mukesh Sahni the Deputy CM's post? The way he has been coerced into submission by the RJD is not lost on his Nishad community."Within the NDA, leaders continue to praise Nitish Kumar’s administrative record, though there is genuine uncertainty over whether Nitish will remain CM.Since 2005, Nitish has led every Bihar election, whether with the NDA or the Mahagathbandhan — but this time, questions persist about whether he will continue if the alliance returns to power.The BJP and JD(U) have agreed to contest 101 seats each under an equal seat-sharing formula. Bihar will vote in two phases on November 6 and 11, with results to be declared on November 14.
Article Summary: Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan endorsed Nitish Kumar as the NDA's chief ministerial face for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections. Paswan’s remarks came days after Amit Shah clarified that the decision on who will be chief minister will be taken after the elections. Bihar will vote in two phases on November 6 and 11, with results to be declared on November 14.

Article Title: EC asks PK to explain in 3 days how he was ‘elector in 2 states’
Article Text:
Prashant Kishor

NEW DELHI: Jan Suraaj Party chief Prashant Kishor was on Tuesday issued a notice by the electoral registration officer (ERO) of Kargahar assembly constituency in Bihar 's Sasaram district for reportedly being enrolled as an elector in both Bihar and West Bengal.Referring to a news report stating Kishor was enrolled in Kargahar as well as Bhowanipore in West Bengal, the ERO asked him to furnish an explanation within three days, as to how he figured in the electoral roll of two different assembly constituencies and states.Sources in the Election Commission said Kishor may have applied for registration as an elector in the second state by filling up Form 6, which is only meant for new registrations. However, he should have applied through Form 8 - pertaining to shifted voters - since he was already enrolled elsewhere at the time.Form 8 allows electors to simultaneously apply for deletion of name from where they are already registered and get enrolled at their new place of residence.The notice sent to Kishor underlined that a person can be enrolled only in one assembly constituency as per Section 17 of the Representation of the People Act, 1950."Its violation attracts one-year imprisonment and/or fine as per Section 31 of the Act," it added.According to the newspaper report published on Tuesday, Kishor is enrolled as an elector at a polling station in Middle School, Konar, in Kargahar as well as at a polling station at St Helen School, B Ranishankari Lane in Bhawanipore.The ERO notice said Kishor's EPIC number as per the roll for Kargahar assembly constituency is IUI3123718.
Article Summary: Jan Suraaj Party chief Prashant Kishor was on Tuesday issued a notice by the electoral registration officer (ERO) for reportedly being enrolled as an elector in both Bihar and West Bengal. A person can be enrolled only in one assembly constituency as per Section 17 of the Representation of the People Act, 1950.

Article Title: Bihar polls: Same-caste candidates will make Magadh battles riveting
Article Text:
Bihar polls

PATNA: Both NDA and INDIA blocs have fielded candidates from the same caste in several constituencies of Magadh region, making for riveting battles, reports Abdul Qadir.Belaganj is particularly gripping. The seat, long regarded as the bastion of RJD strongman Surendra Prasad Yadav, the Jehanabad MP, saw a twist in Nov 2024 when his son Vishvanath Yadav lost to his family's rival, Manorma Devi of JDU, in a bypoll. The father-son duo's image is once again at stake as Vishvanath faces Manorma in a rematch.According to district JDU president Dwarka Prasad, Belaganj is "a prestige fight" since it is contesting only one of 10 assembly segments in Gaya. BJP district president Prem Prakash echoed him.In Bodh Gaya, RJD MLA Kumar Sarvajeet faces LJP (RV)'s Shyam Deo Paswan. Both are Paswans, a community that has historically dominated this seat, winning eight times between 1972 and 2020.A face-off is taking place in Barachatti, where MLA Jyoti Devi takes on RJD's Tanushri Manjhi. Jyoti is related to Union minister and former CM Jitan Ram Manjhi, while Tanushri is the granddaughter of late Bhagwati Devi, both former MLAs from Barachatti.In Wazirganj of Gaya district, Congress veteran Awadhesh Singh faces BJP's Birendra Singh. Both are Rajputs. Awadhesh entered the Bihar assembly in 1980, while Virendra's debut came in 2010.Family rivalry defines the contest in Nawada, where JDU candidate Vibha Devi, wife of Rajballabh Yadav, faces Kaushal Yadav of RJD. Both recently swapped parties.In Hisua, Congress MLA Nitu Kumari and BJP's Anil Singh, both Bhumihars, are in the fray. In Aurangabad, Congress MLA Anand Shankar Singh faces BJP's Trivikram Singh. Both are from the Rajput community.
Article Summary: Both NDA and INDIA blocs have fielded candidates from same caste in several constituencies of Magadh region. Belaganj is particularly gripping. The seat is long regarded as the bastion of RJD strongman Surendra Prasad Yadav, the Jehanabad MP.

Article Title: Nitish will stay NDA CM: BJP clears air after Tejashwi's taunt
Article Text:
Union minister Chirag Paswan (left) and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar

PATNA: NDA Tuesday dismissed suggestions that the alliance may not repeat Nitish Kumar as Bihar CM if voted back into office in upcoming state polls, a move ostensibly aimed at clearing the air as rival INDIA bloc, which has smelt blood after Union minister Amit Shah's recent remarks that a CM is picked by the elected legislators, is increasingly hammering on the issue.Addressing a presser in Patna, BJP spokesman and Lok Sabha MP from Patna Sahib, Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "Nitish has been NDA CM for several years, is the CM face and will remain the CM. There is no vacancy for the CM's post."Citing the statement of Shah that "NDA allies and elected MLAs would decide the CM," Tejashwi had said BJP was using Nitish as a puppet and would not make him CM in the future. Prasad said over past 11-12 years, PM Narendra Modi, "as a brother to Nitish Kumar", has firmly established his commitment to Bihar's development. "The pairing means rock-solid unity for NDA. Tejashwi should take care of his own house," he said.Union minister and LJP (RV) president Chirag Paswan said they have repeatedly said Nitish will be the CM.
Article Summary: NDA dismisses suggestions that the alliance may not repeat Nitish Kumar as Bihar CM if voted back into office in upcoming state polls. Move ostensibly aimed at clearing the air as rival INDIA bloc has smelt blood after Union minister Amit Shah's recent remarks that a CM is picked by the elected legislators.

Article Title: HC stays Karnataka order curbing crowd ahead of RSS march
Article Text:
Karnataka High Court

BENGALURU: The Dharwad bench of Karnataka HC Tuesday stayed state govt's Oct 18 order banning gatherings of more than 10 people in public places, terming them unlawful assemblies punishable under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS).Justice M Nagaprasanna passed the interim order on a petition filed by Punashchethana Seva Samsthe. The order was issued a day before a proposed RSS route march at Chittapur - home constituency of minister Priyank Kharge - where some Dalit organisations had also planned similar rallies. Later, RSS postponed its event to Nov 2. The issue is also pending before the Kalaburagi bench, which will hear the matter on Oct 30.CM Siddaramaiah said, "Dharwad bench has given a stay order. We will appeal before a division bench". The judge posted the matter to Nov 17 for further hearing.BJP MLC Chalavadi Narayanaswamy called it "a slap on state govt," and urged Congress netas to "learn a lesson and respect court rulings."Senior advocate Ashok Haranahalli, representing the petitioners, submitted the order violates constitutional rights: "Suppose I am in a laughter club or a walking group. How can it be unlawful?"Justice Nagaprasanna observed that prima facie, the order curbed rights conferred upon a citizen under Articles 19(1)(a) and 19(1)(b), which guarantee freedom of speech, expression, and assembly.
Article Summary: The Dharwad bench of Karnataka HC Tuesday stayed state govt's Oct 18 order banning gatherings of more than 10 people in public places. The issue is also pending before the Kalaburagi bench, which will hear the matter on Oct 30. The order was issued a day before a proposed RSS route march.

Article Title: Farmer crushed to death in MP: Police arrest key accused, BJP functionary Mahendra Nagar
Article Text:
Ramswaroop Dhakad murder case





NEW DELHI: Police have arrested BJP functionary Mahendra Nagar, accused in the case of farmer Ramswaroop Dhakad’s death in Ganeshpura village, Guna district.Confirming the arrest, SP Ankit Soni said, “The police have now arrested the main accused in this entire murder case, Mahendra Nagar. So far, four people have been arrested in this entire case, who are the main accused in this murder case. The arrest of ten people is still pending. The police had announced a reward of Rs 10,000 on Mahendra Nagar.”According to police, the incident took place on Sunday when Dhakad and his wife were heading to their farm.A group of 10 to 15 armed men allegedly attacked them with iron rods and later ran him over with a vehicle.When his two daughters tried to save him, Nagar allegedly pinned one of them to the ground, sat on her chest and tore her clothes.He has been charged with murder, molestation and criminal conspiracy.Following the incident, Madhya Pradesh BJP chief Hemant Khandelwal expelled Nagar from the party. Police said the attack was linked to a land dispute between the victim and Nagar’s relative, Kanhaiya Nagar, who lives in Pachlavda village in Rajasthan’s Baran district.“The mob fired guns and threatened locals so that the victim could not be taken to a hospital for treatment,” an officer said. Dhakad died within an hour.Nagar, who was the local booth committee chief and a former Kisan Morcha office-bearer, had joined the BJP after Jyotiraditya Scindia and 22 MLAs moved from the Congress to the BJP in March 2020.MP Congress media cell chief Mukesh Nayak said, “Such atrocities by BJP netas and workers on the common man is growing because the party takes no action when such crimes are committed. BJP protects such anti-social elements within the party. The Congress has taken this incident very seriously and will take this up from the streets to the state assembly.”SDOP Bamori Vivek Asthana said, “There was a land dispute between the deceased and one Kanhaiya Nagar, resident of Pachlavda in Rajasthan. There were multiple fractures on his body and his daughters were also attacked. FIR has been registered against 14 persons.”
Article Summary: Police have arrested BJP functionary Mahendra Nagar, accused in the case of farmer Ramswaroop Dhakad’s death in Ganeshpura village, Guna district. Nagar allegedly pinned one of his daughters to the ground, sat on her chest and tore her clothes. He has been charged with murder, molestation and criminal conspiracy.
